decks.notes: The main strategy of this deck is to utilize the Fires of Invention card to play multiple spells for free each turn, exerting control over the board and gaining card advantage. The deck includes powerful control elements such as Deafening Clarion, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Elspeth Conquers Death to keep the opponent's threats in check. The creatures in the deck, like Kenrith, the Returned King, Cavalier of Flame, and Sphinx of Foresight, provide additional ways to control the game and pressure the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through powerful late-game threats and control elements.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free and control the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion. The strategy is to stall the game until the player can drop big threats like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight, while also utilizing Kenrith, the Returned King for versatility. The deck also includes Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion for extra value. Overall, the key concept is to control the game through powerful spellcasting and strategic plays.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively build a board presence with low-cost creatures such as Cauldron Familiar, Serrated Scorpion, and Gutterbones, while using cards like Claim the Firstborn and Witch's Oven to disrupt and control your opponent's board. By sacrificing creatures to abilities like Mayhem Devil and Woe Strider, this deck aims to deal damage to the opponent and gain incremental advantages over time. Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds another layer of damage to the deck's strategy, making it even more threatening in a 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage. The deck utilizes a variety of counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Absorb, removal spells such as Shatter the Sky, and card draw engines like Omen of the Sea and Thirst for Meaning. With powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as strong finishers like Dream Trawler, the deck aims to slow down the game and outvalue the opponent.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, allowing the player to control the game by playing threats and answers without needing to worry about mana. It includes a mix of control elements such as counterspells and board wipes, along with powerful creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight. The deck also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way to provide additional value and card advantage. Overall, the strategy is to establish control of the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Gyruda, Doom of Depths as a companion to consistently mill cards from both players' libraries and cheat out powerful creatures. By combining ramp spells like Migration Path and Growth Spiral with ETB creatures like Spark Double and Thassa, Deep-Dwelling, the deck aims to generate massive value and overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of Charming Prince and Elite Guardmage provides additional utility and card advantage, while Dream Trawler and Luminous Broodmoth offer protection and evasion for the deck's key combo pieces.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively play low-cost spells and creatures to deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Shock, Blitz of the Thunder-Raptor, and Arclight Phoenix, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with a continuous stream of threats. The inclusion of Rielle, the Everwise and Cathartic Reunion allow for card advantage and refill the hand, ensuring the deck can continue to push damage and pressure the opponent. Ultimately, the goal is to outpace the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The key concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to control the board through counterspells and removal while also generating card advantage with flash creatures like Brazen Borrower and Sea-Dasher Octopus. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with evasive threats such as Brineborn Cutthroat and Slitherwisp, using their abilities to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Spectral Sailor and Omen of the Sea provide additional card draw and consistency to ensure the deck can maintain its aggression and disrupt the opponent's strategies effectively.

The main concept of this deck revolves around playing powerful spells for free using Fires of Invention while controlling the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and using Sphinx of Foresight to dig for key pieces. The deck also has strong finishers like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King, with Keruga as a companion to draw more cards. Narset of the Ancient Way provides card advantage and removal, while Teferi, Time Raveler can be disruptive to opponent's plans. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win with its powerful creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with a mix of removal spells and powerful creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King. By ramping into Fires of Invention early on, the deck is able to cast multiple spells per turn for free, allowing for big swings in tempo and enabling powerful plays. The Sphinx of Foresight helps with card selection and setting up future turns, while Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption and protection for your own spells. The overall goal is to maintain board control and pressure your opponent until you can secure the win.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on a sacrifice strategy, utilizing cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Cruel Celebrant to create a loop of sacrificing and dealing damage to the opponent. By sacrificing creatures and utilizing abilities like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Fiend Artisan, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with constant pressure and incremental advantages. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional synergy and recursion, making it a resilient and aggressive deck that can quickly close out games.

The main concept of this deck is to abuse the Gyruda, Doom of Depths companion ability by having a high density of even-CMC cards in the deck. By utilizing cards such as Spark Double and Thassa, Deep-Dwelling, the deck aims to create a powerful engine that can generate value and tempo advantage by repeatedly triggering powerful enters-the-battlefield effects. The deck also includes cards like Humble Naturalist and Paradise Druid to ramp up mana quickly in order to play Gyruda as early as possible and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free and gain control of the game. It includes a mix of removal spells such as Deafening Clarion and creatures like Cavalier of Flame to control the board. The inclusion of Keruga as a companion enables card advantage and consistency in the deck. With a mix of control elements and powerful creatures like Kenrith and Haktos, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy using a combination of powerful planeswalkers and enchantments. By utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, the deck can deploy threats while holding up counterspells and removal. The inclusion of cards like Fae of Wishes and Shark Typhoon provides versatility and allows the deck to adapt to different situations. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by flickering permanents for extra card advantage. In essence, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of control elements and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the board by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn. It includes powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion, along with threats like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight. The goal is to maintain board presence and card advantage while controlling the opponent's actions. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion provides additional card draw and synergy with the high converted mana cost of the deck's spells.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to utilize sacrifice effects and recursion synergy to overwhelm the opponent with quick and aggressive plays. By constantly sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Serrated Scorpion, and bringing them back with cards like Call of the Death-Dweller, the deck aims to chip away at the opponent's life total while generating value. This strategy is supported by cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, creating a powerful and efficient aggro engine.
